Package chess.model.moves

Class Castling

java.lang.Object
chess.model.Colored
chess.model.moves.Movable
chess.model.moves.Movement
chess.model.moves.RegularMove
chess.model.moves.Castling
All Implemented Interfaces:
chess.persistence.Codable
public final class Castling extends RegularMove
A subcategory of the regular move that represents a Castling, with a King being the subject piece of the main movement and a target Rook making a subsequent regular move.

Castling will be offered if and only if:

  1. The King is not in check (the Rook, however, can be threatened);
  2. The passage between the King and the target Rook are vacant;
  3. The passage between the King and the target Rook are not under attack;
  4. Both the King and the target Rook are on their first move (i.e. have not been moved previously).
A King may castle with either Rooks (King-side or Queen-side) so long as these preconditions (in no particular order) are satisfied.

During the move:

  1. The King is moved two squares toward the target Rook.
  2. The target Rook is moved to the other side of the King.
Visually, King-side Castling: 
 _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _       _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _
 _ _ _ _ ♚ _ _ ♜   →   _ _ _ _ _ ♜ ♚ _
Queen-side Castling: 
 _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _       _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _
 ♜ _ _ _ ♚ _ _ _   →   _ _ ♚ ♜ _ _ _ _
Castling can only be applied to King's and not Rook's.

  • Constructor Details

    • Castling

      public Castling(King king, Position kingFinalPosition, Rook rook, Position rookFinalPosition)
      Constructs a Castling for a subject King and a target Rook.
      Parameters:
      king - The target King.
      kingFinalPosition - The final position of the target King.
      rook - The target Rook (King-side or Queen-side).
      rookFinalPosition - The final position of the target Rook.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If any of the arguments is null.

  • Method Details

    • encode

      public org.json.JSONObject encode()
      Serializes this Castling to a JSON object of the following structure: 
       {
     [..1..],
     "rookMove": {
         [..2..]
     }
 }
      where the placeholders:
      • [..1..] is where the info for King's regular move is stored;
      • [..2..] is where the info for Rook's regular move is stored.
      See Castling(JSONObject, Chessboard) for details.
      Specified by:
      encode in interface chess.persistence.Codable
      Overrides:
      encode in class Movement
      Returns:
      A serialized object ready to be written.
      See Also:
      • Movement.encode()

    • execute

      public int execute(Chessboard chessboard)
      Executes this Castling on the given chessboard and increments the move count of both the King and the Rook.

      As a result, the King is moved to its specified final position, followed by the Rook also moving to its specified final position.

      Overrides:
      execute in class RegularMove
      Parameters:
      chessboard - The chessboard on which this Castling is executed.
      Returns:
      0 points, since a Castling is associated with no points.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If chessboard is null.

    • undo

      public int undo(Chessboard chessboard)
      Undoes this Castling on the given chessboard and decrements the move count of both the King and the Rook.

      As a result, the Rook's move is undone and the King is moved back to its initial position.

      Overrides:
      undo in class RegularMove
      Parameters:
      chessboard - The chessboard on which this Castling is undone.
      Returns:
      0 points, since a Castling is associated with no points.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If chessboard is null.

    • getRook

      public Rook getRook(Chessboard chessboard)
      Returns:
      The target Rook of this Castling.

    • getDescriptor

      public String getDescriptor()
      Returns a left arrow as the descriptor text for capture.
      Returns:
      A left arrow (←, \u2190).
